channel.title: What's wrong with Uppit?
channel.description: I used Uppit to upload my cache and jar file. Personally I find it very easy to use, and it could be debated that it is even easier and faster to use than Dropbox. I just don't understand why it isn't used more often and why Dropbox is usually preferred over Uppit. I may be wrong but I would just like to know.

item.title: What's wrong with Uppit?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“arean1, post:3, topic:550289”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=669201.msg4474907#msg4474907 date=1425162375]
Because uppit doesn’t support instant download links?
[/quote]

No it does, if you click the “generate link” button you will see another button which says “download” which you right click and there you can obtain the direct link.[/quote]
Yeah, see… That’s extra work. And also that link you’re talking about can change (I think there is a reason it says “Generate”)
On dropbox (though this changed in an update), they would give you a public folder. You would be able to literally drop files into the folder, right click, and hit copy link.

And you’d have the instant download link and be good to go.

Also, another thing, dropbox probably has more servers worldwide than uppit. I’ve heard many people complain that uppit wouldn’t work whatsoever.

Read full topic

item.title: What's wrong with Uppit?
item.dc:creator: @arean1 arean1
item.description:
@arean1 wrote:

Davidi2:

You can’t really compare the two. Dropbox has about 500 million more features than uppit and is a different service. Uppit works fine if you’re just uploading a file you want to never change, but besides that it doesn’t really do anything. Dropbox lets you manage files, permissions, sync, has a desktop app, the list goes on and on and on.

Alright my good sir, thank-you for the detailed response. However, I still feel Uppit is more helpful in my case but regardless the comparison is useful the see.

Read full topic
